meanings.definition: In a way that produces a great deal of profit or wealth.
meanings.sent1: The company expanded lucratively, doubling its profits in just one year.
meanings.sent2: She invested in stocks that grew lucratively over time.
meanings.sent3: The idea of selling ice to Eskimos seemed lucratively absurd.
meanings.sent4: Her savings account bloomed lucratively like a well-tended garden.
meanings.sent5: The treasure hunt ended lucratively with a chest full of gold coins.

meanings.definition: In a manner that is highly profitable or financially rewarding.
meanings.sent1: The online business ran lucratively, attracting many customers.
meanings.sent2: He negotiated the deal lucratively, securing a substantial commission.
meanings.sent3: The magician's hat produced lucratively endless rabbits.
meanings.sent4: Her baking skills proved lucratively magical, selling out pastries daily.
meanings.sent5: The investment in real estate turned out lucratively, providing a steady income stream.
